go_data.justification: CD40 is activated in germinal center dendritic cells, which play a pivotal role in germinal center reactions and induce strong stimulation of CD4+ T cells.
CD40 activation results in the induction of decysin, a novel metalloproteinase, in response to T cell signals.
CD40-activated germinal center dendritic cells express high levels of the message in the germinal center.
CD40 is activated by anti-CD40 antibody G28-5, indicating its role as a receptor.
